attr.q:
Let f : \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R} be given by

f(x) = \begin{cases} -1\text{, } &x \leq 0 \\ 1\text{, } &x > 0 \end{cases}
Prove that f is not continuous using the method of Example 5.1.6.
Find f^{-1}\{1\} and, using Proposition 5v1v9, deduce that f is not continuous.
attr.a: The closed set f^{-1} is (0, \infin) which is open. Hence not continuous.
